title: Hire the worker if MRP equals MFC

content.question: Assume that a profit-maximizing, perfectly competitive firm hires labor in a perfectly competitive labor market. If the market wage is $12 per hour and the price of the product is $3 per unit, the firm will

choices.label: hire more workers if each worker can produce 3 units per hour
hire another worker if the output per hour of the additional worker exceeds 4 units
hire fewer workers, since the hourly wage exceeds the cost of producing one unit of output
not hire any workers, since the cost of labor is greater than the price of the output
continue to operate in the short run but not in the long run

content.answer: hire another worker if the output per hour of the additional worker exceeds 4 units

topic.text: 5.3: Profit-Maximizing Behavior in Perfectly Competitive Factor Markets
